context: Levätä is a Finnish verb that means to rest, relax, or take a break. It's used when someone needs to recover from physical exertion, stress, or fatigue. The word often implies taking time off from normal activities to allow the body and mind to recharge. It can be used in various forms including present tense (levään), past tense (leväsin/leväsivät), and future tense (lenän).
